review: This place is AVERAGE AT BEST !! Everything I had I could have had at the CORNER BAR and it would have been JUST AS GOOD -if not BETTER !! Don't WASTE YOUR TIME THERE !

Let's make this simple: Servers: Very friendly and the only saving grace Bar Staff: Painfully Slow Kitchen: Painfully slow and very dirty since you can see everything as you go to the restrooms. Management: Nonexistant...Probably in the office looking for a new place to work. Hosts: Blonde and pretty without any gray matter between the ears and not so friendly.  Survey on bottom of the check : not working?!?!

This was an overall disappointment.  Our first issue was that the light directly over our table flickered like crazy and was annoying during dinner.  We did bring it to the attention of the server, but he couldn't do anything and there was no effort on his part to inform the manager, which was what should have been done.  From the food we ordered, the Quesadilla Explosion was eh, nothing to write home about. The ribs and steak were good, but the mashed potatoes were dry.  The kids Mac and Cheese was not good for my kid, however, my dad liked it.  Which means it's loaded with salt.  When I tasted it, all I tasted was salt too.  Corn side for kid was really good.

We arrived at the Riverdale location and were greeted by the hostess and informed there would be a short 15-20 minute wait for a table.  As it was Saturday evening during the prime time for dining we were expecting this.  The estimate was right to the minute as we were being seated almost exactly 20 minutes later.  Our host gave us a choice of table or booth (which was very accommodating with the kids) and we chose the booth.   The children were provided with crayons and a menu to color which was wonderful to keep them occupied as we all decided what we would like to order.  Unfortunately this would be where our problems began.  We waited at least 10 minutes before our waitress came by to take our drink order.  Our waitress introduced herself and informed us that she and a shadow would be waiting on us.  At that point we surmised that she was probably new and in training so we were understanding of the wait and expected to be patient with a new employee.  She was very pleasant and took our drink order.  Upon return we informed her that we knew what we wanted and ordered appetizers and our meals at the same time.  She did a good job of refilling our drinks but we were still waiting for our appetizers 20 minutes later.  After 25 minutes a runner came to our table and brought our children's dinner.  My wife and I both assumed our appetizers were not put in or were delivered to the wrong table.  At this point my wife and I still had no appetizers and still did not have our dinner.  I flagged her down to inform her of what was happening and she assured us our appetizers had been put in first.  She offered to take the food back and correct the order but our children were quite hungry at that point and we thought it best to let them eat.   A few minutes later our appetizers were delivered by the manager and we thought our concerns were behind us.  The manager asked us if we needed anything else and we asked for a refill of our chips and salsa (best chips we have ever had, by the way); the chip refill never appeared at our table.  My wife's southwestern spring rolls were, as usual, cooked well and quite tasty.  I ordered the trio with sliders and boneless Buffalo wings.  While both were tasty, both were cold, the burgers being undercooked as well.   Again we flagged her down to inform her of the problems.  She took my order away and said she would have the kitchen remake it.  Another 15 minutes or so went by; my wife had finished her appetizer and our children were well on their way to finishing their dinners.  We still had not gotten our dinners or my appetizer.  At this point our children had already finished their meals, I was waiting on my appetizer and both my wife's dinner and mine were still not at our table.  We decided that we would not be willing to wait any longer and we were going to cancel the appetizer and just wait for the rest of our order.  We waited an additional 15 minutes for our dinners to come out and, although she came to us at one point during that time to tell us the food would be out shortly, it still never came.  Since our children were already done eating, and we were getting frustrated with our wait, we informed her that we wanted to cancel both of our dinners and just get the check. Amazingly, this came of no shock what so ever and her reply was simply "sure" as she walked away.  We were somewhat surprised that, even as a new employee, this was not more of an alarm for concern.  Coincidentally, the booth directly next to ours and separated by the shared wall observed our problems and informed us that, they too, had problems with raw food.  The manager happened to be at their booth and we asked him to come to ours when he finished dealing with the problems at their table. Upon the manager's arrival he apologized and told us he would be covering our dinner order, more than half of which never came out.  He did say they were full staffed and could not account for the mistakes throughout the course of our dinner.  I mentioned that even the chips we asked him for never arrived and he did say he had asked another person to take care of that for him.  While he did offer to have our food made for us to take home we had order seafood (which does not reheat well) and, at this point, lost our appetite anyway.  He again apologized and, in an attempt at humor (I can only guess) said to us "I guess you will be hitting the Burger King drive thru on your way home?"  That really did not set too well with any of us as our children were already upset we had not eaten with them and were concerned about us not having eaten any dinner at all. As long standing and, until last night, very satisfied customers my family felt there was little done to make sure we returned.  Actually there was no mention at all about us returning, their improvement or even retaining us as customers.  The comment about a trip to the drive thru at a fast food restaurant was in poor taste at best

This place is a joke. We walked in at about 3PM on a Sunday and it took ten minutes for our waitress, Tracy, to come to our table after we sat down.  It took almost twenty minutes to get our appetizers and damn near 45 minutes to get our entrees. Our orders were incorrect but since our waitress never came to check on us we did not bother correcting them. Noone walking by could be bothered to take our dirty dishes. I couldn't help but notice dirty dishes on the bar that sat there my entire visit, & drinks the bartender set out that serves let sit for twenty minutes. During my meal, a large group walkedin and waited for ten minutes at the host stand before one of them had to walk to the bar to ask who he had to see to get a table. From the kitchen to the management, every single aspect of this place is a joke. They did not deserve the money we paid for our meal, and even though we are typically generous tippers, the waitress did not deserve the little tip we decided to give her.

Visited the Riverdale, NJ Chili's this evening with my wife and mother. I myself have been to this Chili's 5 times in the past month and on three occasions observed one particular server going about her routine that impressed me a lot... and not just because she's easy on the eyes (very). While the rest of the staff look to be doing their jobs very well, Christina is consistently remarkable. Tonight was the first time she was with the pair/team serving my table directly, and her speed, effort, energy was as impressive as ever. An easy socializer, good humored, knowledgeable and never seems to miss the smallest detail- even on tables she ISN'T working. If something looks amiss, she's on it before anyone can notice to complain. A real pro and the type of employee I'd try to steal were I a business owner myself. My wife and I made it a point to pull her over to tell her all this to her face tonight as it's always easy to complain about bad service, and too few say anything, even when it's exemplary. Christina- you are precisely that. The food and drinks are otherwise exactly what you expect from a good kitchen in a chain restaurant. Chili's menu isn't *my* cup of tea, so my choices are few, but what I order is always done quite well.

I love chain places like this that are outside New York City because the people who work there are so much nicer, the food is better made and the prices aren't ridiculous. What is that about? This place was really nice. I've come here twice - each time after visiting Mountain Creek waterpark. The most recent time I came here with 3 other people, we ordered 2-3 appetizers and an entree each, maybe a couple drinks. The bill came out to like $54. That is amazing! Looking forward to my next visit!

Soup came out cold, sent back. New bowl was hot.   Chicken bacon avocado lunch sandwich was disappointing with one little sliver of avocado on it.  Asked for more avocado and was given some.   Friend got a bowl of chili and it too was cold. All this after waiting about 45 minutes.  I don't believe it was our servers fault and she was nice. The bar was on top of things too.  The problem I believe is in the kitchen.  Spoke with the manager who said it was very busy today. I don't think that is a good excuse for cold food twice. She adjusted our price to try to make up for the issues. I would have given one star if they had not adjusted the price or given the extra avocado.   In Riverdale you have a choice between Chili's and Appleby's.  Go to Appleby's.

I had a good experience here. The food is good its a chain after all so nothing super special. But I have say the service is great. The waiter Joe and waitress crystal are both wonderful people. I went for lunch the with my 3 year old son there the other day and I was already seated and I ordered my food and app already when I went into my bag and noticed my wallet was not in there I panicked and felt completely embarrassed. But joe and crystal assured me that it was alright and that I could go home get the wallet and come back or call my husband and get our cc info through him so I can pay the bill. I ended up calling my husband. It was nice to see that they actually trusted me enough to leave come back and pay  the bill without stiffing them.

Waitress was nice, food was okay, I got a shrimp and chicken fajita, I liked the shrimp however, the chicken was blah, the margarita was overly priced $9 and half of it was ice, but it did taste good.  Got a coupon for free tortillas and guacamole dip I believe which was pretty good. My experience was okay.

I was not a fan of this Chili's originally when they opened but in the last year it has really become a great place.  Yes, It is a chain but really good at what they do. There is such an improvement in customer service that it must get noted.  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  Last time we were there we had a waitress Chelsea who was FANTASTIC and such a pleasure!  We were a group of 5- all drinks were great, food was really very good and the service was also excellent!  BRAVO Chili's for listening to your customers and making a huge improvement!

I went to a Chili's for my first ever visit. It was Saturday at noon. I was greeted and promptly seated. As it was my first time here, Katie and Lisa gave me time to review the menu. I ordered the Margarita Chicken Bowl with Shrimp and Spiced Panko Onion Rings as well as a Paloma (Tequila, grapefruit juice and Sprite.) I watch various sporting events on the tv while listening to U2 and soft rock. The service and food were great. I imagine the place could get loud since the place lacks a tiled ceiling which makes for greater acoustics.

The new "lighter options" menu is very appealing. I ordered the mango chicken which had a nice Caribbean jerk tang and a refreshing sweetness with the mango chunks. This could be a new "go to" at chilis.
Great Place and hard working staff.  I miss the dry rub ribs and jalapeño corn bread. Taken off the menu.
Wife and I love chilis and this is one of the better ones. Once in awhile we have a bad experience but in general food is fresh and service is great. I'm a regular
Nice place, but on weekends it can get really loud. Nice food, good service, but the wait was a bit too long, and it was crowded, but on weekdays, it is a nice place (in the afternoon)

Although this is an average chain I have to give the staff 5 stars for service with a smile ... Both times I've come I had Chris as my waiter and he is so nice ! I have a one year old who makes a huge mess and they don't make me feel bad at all .. Tonight we went in for late dinner and again a mess but smiles still continue.. Last time we were there he spilled a full glass of water and they didn't care .. Just wanted to compliment Chris ... Thank u !

A Typical Chili's clean restaurant and half way decent food. My double cheese burger was burnt all around the egdes and the the cheese was way messy. I have to say I hate the kiosk way to pay. Long gone the interaction of server and guest. It even tells you what to tip. Overall just a chain restaurant with nothing noteworthy. Except you can watch A Marshall Football game at the bar.

Came here for happy hour - turns out they're running a promotion where you can get $5 presidential margarita, and they come with a shaker that pours out (total) 6??? drinks. SO AWESOME. Got the strawberry mango and it was delicious and lasted my entire meal.  2 for $20 is always awesome. My friend and I shared a margarita flat bread (not on the 2 for $20 menu) & chips and salsa for the apps. I got the guacamole burger with a black pram patty and it was DELICIOUS but an absolute mess to eat. Everything kept falling out of the bun, I must have went through a trees worth of napkins. But the meal was awesome, and our friend Spencer who was bartending is super cool and friendly. Would have gotten dessert if we weren't so stuffed!

Thanks for being open and no one there to seat us, at the bar or anywhere in the restaurant at 11:30am. Stood around for a few minutes then left because no one was there but your doors are open. Weird.

Always disappointing. Salsa is runny.. Service is slow and inattentive. We've dined here a few times always hoping the experience will be better but that hasn't happened yet. Try Applebee's instead. Only a mile up 23 but has a nice menu and great happy hour specials.

Stopped in for a late lunch and was not impressed.  The staff were very nice and friendly. Quick to get drink orders. But there seemed to be only two people working the floor and it was not enough.  The food. The table side guacamole was "ok" but if you're used to real guacamole it will leave you disappointed. Burger and fries were decent, except the kitchen put mustard on my burger which I didn't request and don't eat. No one checked in after the dishes came out so I took the bread off and wiped the patty with a napkin.  The drinks. Coffee was never freshened up and there was no water placed on the table.

I go here regularly for lunch, and although I like the soup and salad special, the problems I've otherwise encountered are preventing me from going back: incompetent or inattentive wait staff, cold food, under cooked food, problems with those small on-table computers they use, etc. It seems like every other time I go in, there's another issue to contend with. I think I've had it with Chili's in Riverdale. I don't need the aggravation.
Love  the wings and quesadillas.Really packs a punch of flavor,and is a party in your mouth.

The  best Chili's by far you will ever go to. Triple dipper appetizer is excellent. Onion rings, mini burgers, and the chicken eggrolls in particular . Everything I had was fresh and very good quality. Top shelf Patron Margaritas are excellent. The servers, Nick and some girl I couldn't remember her name he works with could not be nicer and more attentive. If you are going to choose a chain in this area for a casual night out that is very fairly priced,  you can't go wrong here.

Went there yesterday for lunch and I must say I was very disappointed. I ordered the crispy chicken tenders and they gave me only 3 bite size portions, which is vastly different from what they used to serve. Fries that were ordered extra crispy were soggy and corn on the cob was bland. Only part of lunch that I enjoyed was my beer. Doubt I'll be going back again.

Just wen to try to get a table for dinner. The two men standing at the host area completely ignored me. I stood there patiently waiting while they called people and ignored me. I'm 6'6" wearing a red shirt kinda hard to miss. Have been to this location before and it was mediocre at best. Taking the time to greet me even to say they would be just a minute would have been appropriate. Very disappointing customer service

My typical lunch spot with the office crew! Fast service - complicated orders come out right - staff is well trainer - Being able to reorder/checkout from the new table top devices makes things easy and fast!

This is a great place to eat dinner two nights in a row with a man who is not your father but whom people thinj might be. We also had dinner with a woman who met Jacques Cousteau. She worked at a non-pornographic magazine called 'Skindiver' and was presently in the process of becoming our apprentice. My name is Alex and my friend Alex was dining with us as well. We both had a quesadilla. It tasted like how I expect food to taste in a boardertown. We felt alive with the night. We all had three beers. Our waiter had a wrist brace but he wasn't a rollerbladers. Keith had lots of soup. I had to dock one star because I had to use the lobby bathroom this morning.
I would go if you have a coupon aka nothing special if you don't get a deal. I would order the guacamole and any of the fresh mex bowls.

My friends and I come here all the time for the margaritas, half off apps & the 2 for 20 deal. Service is always great, they're very attentive & I can't say I've ever been disappointed. Definitely my Go-To spot for a quick yummy dinner!

My usual spot I come for lunch. Super convenient with the new tablet system that allows fast service. I like that they have a rewards membership that you can sign up and ear points towards free items. I usually get the lunch specials and pick the house salad and the chicken bacon ranch quesadillas with fries that are really good and at a good price. Everything comes out super quick and is really fresh. I love their chips and salsa as well as their guacamole as well. Being able to pay on the tablet eliminates having to chase down the waitress for your check and makes leaving to get back to work on time a much easier obstacle.
Great place for lunch or dinner. Good, varied menu, great waitstaff and the food is delicious.  Best nacho chips around!

Went here to eat on a Sunday night. Was very disappointed. Food is so average to blah. The only thing that probably keeps the place up is the great waitstaff. Drinks are ok as well. Not for me with the quality, price and amounts of food. Maybe for drinks and definitely not to eat
This location is very good. Others not so much. I have has some issues with one meal I order frequently but the managers always get it fixed. Overall, I enjoy the food here.
Good for the standard of the restaurant. Sometimes gets a little busy but what restaurant doesn't? Clean. Usually sit at bar. Never had a bad experience.

I went to this Chili's this past weekend. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because of the wait time in between our food. I got the 3 courses for $10. We also had to wait a little between being seated and having our waiter and  waitress but that wasn't that bad. Between the salad and the entree portions of our meal it took a long time for the next one to come. I feel like a good 15 minutes passed after we finished the salad. The place itself was full but there wasn't that much of a wait to get in. We did call ahead seating which was perfect cause it made us go right in rather then waiting the maybe 10 minutes we would have had. other then that little fluke before it was perfect. Everyone was great, the food was delicious, etc. I would still go back again.

Standard Chilis location. Restaurant is clean and we've had the manager visit us during several different visits. She seems to really care about guest satisfaction.  I have noticed that this location takes significantly longer to get an initial contact than other restaurants or Chili locations I've been to. I don't mind waiting, but I don't like being left to wonder if a waitress knows she has a new table or not. But once things get rolling we've always been set.

It really doesn't get much better than this folks.  How does Chili's screw up a single-simple TO-GO order? I should have known I was trouble when I walked into Chili's and there was a guy already complaining that they screwed up his giant TO-GO order from the previous week.  Would it really have hurt to go back and make sure the order was actually correct? A main dish with no sides!! DOES THAT SEEM OFF TO ANYONE?!

what can I say?  yes sometimes I do go to chain restaurants like chilies for example which is my favorite chain restaurant of all time!!! I love everything about chilies the way that they are very affordable they have really good food for being a chain restaurant maybe it's not the lowest calories but who cares  I love the triple dipper I love the house drinks they're amazing and I've been coming here since forever since I grew up in the area   loyal customer

We decided to have lunch at chilis today. I can't even remember when was the last time I ate at a chilis. Being a typical chain restaurant, I wasn't expecting much.  We were seated within a min. The waitress was very nice and gave us enough time to go through the menu. They had a lot of options, almost too much. I decided to just go to the lunch combo page after a bit.  I chose the chicken fajitas lunch combo with Chicken tortilla soup. The soup was very tasty. I was surprised that I would enjoy it so much. The sizzling grilled chicken fajitas with peppers, onions, chipotle-garlic butter & cilantro was served nice and hot. The chicken was very moist and tasty. The side plate of pico de gallo, cheddar cheese & cumin-lime sour cream was just enough for the fajita. Overall a good meal for $8 plus tax and tips.

The food is decent with a relaxing atmosphere. It's a good place for an affordable meal; however, service is very slow. Don't go here if you are pressed for time. I ordered soup and salad with the chicken enchilada soup. The soup was seasoned well and hot, but the salad was dull. However for dessert we enjoyed the skillet chocolate chip cookie which is a hot cookie topped by a scoop of vanilla ice cream with hot fudge.

What happened here in the past few months? Serice has been progressively worse for the past 6 months. Last time I was here it took about 10 minutes to get our drink order taken. The waiters also disappeared for long periods during the meal which seems to be the norm the past few times I was there. A few visits ago I left without taking my leftovers because it had been 10+ minutes since I asked for a box  The food is pretty good for a chain and prices are reasonable.  I used to like going here every now and then  but honestly the service issues make me not want to come back.

Just came out of the movies and my S.O. Decided we should try Chili's which was  just across the street. Hadn't been there in some time. Ordered the DIY Fahitas, chicken wings and a salad. Wings were okay, Salad was barely passable  and the Fahitas were just awful. The Fahita pancakes were so old and dried out, They fell apart on your plate. The ingredients needed a major overhaul to be even apatizing. I remember when Chili's had the best  Fahitas in town, but forget about those days. Those days are long gone. It seems people go to Chili's because they have a bar, but if you are going there to eat, find another restaurant. Folks forget about this place. Their money is spent on advertising not on the food. I guess if you want a drink this place is okay, but if you want good food, try another place. The service was very good as was the fruity drink of the day, which was also very good. Like so many places, the food has gone downhill and the drinks were fair, though expensive. I would have given this place one star, except for my drink which was delicious.

Wow..  I guess I only come here for a free meal on Vet's day lol..  Well, a year to the day, I'm back...  Back with my gorgeous wife and Mother in Law for a nice lunch on Vet's day...  It wasn't too crowded when we got there about 11:45 and we were immediately seated in the bar area.  I think when you're seated there, you have a couple servers to take care of you - and we were taken care of very good.  I was handed the Vet's menu and it has a few nice offers on it, but I was craving some taco's on this day..   So, I ordered their Ranchero Taco's off their main menu that comes with Mexican rice and red beans, with a small side of sour cream and gwok-a-moly.  My mother in law ordered the soup or chili and salad and chips n' salsa combo for lunch, which was on the Vet's menu...  Unbeknownst to us at the time, our server gave me my Taco's for free and charged us for the other meal my Mother in law had.  That was very nice of her and saved me a few bucks.   Also, the service was top-notch!  Our drinks were always filled and our chips n' salsa were topped off when they were running on empty.  Food was brought out in a reasonable time and all our dishes were very yummy.  Also, whenever I received a refill of iced tea, I was given a fresh lemon wedge with my tea..  It's the little things and that's a huge pet peeve of mine.  I wish I could remember our main server's name, but she was leaving for Florida that night..  I need to remember to ask to give credit where credit is due. All in all, great service and great food.  It was about 12:30ish or so by now and the place had a waiting list... So, that's a good thing!  Thank you Chili's of Riverdale...  We'll be back!  Highly Recommended!
It not fine dining, but it's good for what it is. Only complaint is there was only one bartender for the whole place on a football Sunday?? So service was slow.
